page.title: 19LAUNCESTON'S WATER SUPPLY
page.content: The{town's water}has always been stored in a reservoir on{Windmill Hill above the Leisure Centre and until about 10 years ago was uncovered.We visited the water treatment works at { {Bastreet}which pipes water 12 miles to us.At Bastreet,on the edge of Bodmin Moor,the intake from{Withey Brook}is 2000,000 gallons a day.The system of filtering the water through pebbles, anthracite and silver sand takes place in exterior tanks.We saw the machinery for the addition of alum and soda to make the water more acidic in good weather or Decapol in bad weather to make it more alkaline.Before it is stored in a 1000,000 gallon{reservoir} for distribution,chlorine and carbon are also added.Next we went South West to{Sibly Back}which is a man-made{lake used for{recreation}and to maintain the{water level}in Withey Brook.
